â€¦ æƒ³è¯»ç§é’¥ä½†æ˜¯ä¸çŸ¥é“å‘½åï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å°† readfile æ‹‰å‡ºæ¥é€†å‘

int __fastcall main(int argc, const char **argv, const char **envp)
{
  struct stat stat_buf; // [rsp+20h] [rbp-4B0h] BYREF
  char buf[1024]; // [rsp+B0h] [rbp-420h] BYREF
  int v6; // [rsp+4B0h] [rbp-20h]
  int fd; // [rsp+4B4h] [rbp-1Ch]
  unsigned __int64 v8; // [rsp+4B8h] [rbp-18h]
  char *v9; // [rsp+4C0h] [rbp-10h]
  char *v10; // [rsp+4C8h] [rbp-8h]

  if ( argc == 2 )
  {
    if ( access(argv[1], 0) )
    {
      puts("File Not Found");
      return 1;
    }
    else if ( getuid() == 1002 )
    {
      v10 = strstr(argv[1], "flag");
      v9 = strstr(argv[1], "id_rsa");
      lstat((char *)argv[1], &stat_buf);
      HIDWORD(v8) = (stat_buf.st_mode & 0xF000) == 40960;
      LODWORD(v8) = access(argv[1], 4);
      usleep(0);
      if ( v10 || v8 >= 0xFFFFFFFF || v9 )
      {
        puts("Nice try!");
        return 1;
      }
      else
      {
        puts("I guess you won!\n");
        fd = open(argv[1], 0);
        if ( fd < 0 )
          __assert_fail("fd >= 0 && \"Failed to open the file\"", "readfile.c", 0x26u, "main");
        do
          v6 = read(fd, buf, 0x400uLL);
        while ( v6 > 0 && write(1, buf, v6) > 0 );
        return 0;
      }
    }
    else
    {
      puts("You can't run this program");
      return 1;
    }
  }
  else
  {
    puts("Usage: ./readfile <FILE>");
    return 1;
  }
}
